item.title: Rubbish on pathway as no bin, 10th November
item.description:
Bin removed and lots of cans and bottles are dropped in path between station catpark and sidcup bypass. They haven't been cleared despite earlier report
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 513, Sidcup Road, Coldharbour, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: PUBLIC DANGER - Huge quantities of fallen leaves unswept., 10th November
item.description:
It’s autumn, we get it, leaves fall. But with the quantity of dropped leaves and the infrequent sweeping - it has really become a hazard. It is impossible to see the edge of the curb/pavement which is a tripping risk. And the leaves are, of course, slippery when wet. Why don’t you leave sacks with residents to sweep and bag the fallen leaves, which you then pick up? My brown bin is completely full as is that of neighbouring properties. So give residents some bags and we will supplement the council services which are no longer provided.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 84, East Dulwich Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road sunk, 10th November
item.description:
Been advised it's been dealt with, still got same issue. Road has been repaired now sunk It's dangerous as you come down the road towards Park View Road as the road has sunk, it's dangerous turning into the access road at back of the flats as you need to go onto the damaged road to turn left.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Roseacre Road, Welling, London

item.title: Faulty Streetlight on SE181PN, 10th November
item.description:
The Streetlight mounted on the wall of the building between House Numbers 18 and 19 on our street is faulty and has not been functioning for some time, resulting in complete darkness across the surrounding area during the night. This lack of lighting poses safety concerns for residents, particularly pedestrians and elderly individuals, and increases the risk of accidents or unwanted incidents.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Philimore Close, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bikes blocking pedestrian passage, 10th November
item.description:
Lime bikes neatly placed onto both sides of the pavement and a corner of Downham and Ufton Rdls leaving too narrow passage for pedestrians on one side ( no pram, mobility scooter, disabled person wheelchair etc could Go through) and blocking turn into Ufton Rd completely, forcing pedestrians onto bike lane to turn, Illegal parking of lime, the bikes must have been freshly placed there by Lime themselves not by users.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downham Road, Dalston, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large glass waste from street moved into private bin area, 10th November
item.description:
On County Street, opposite Brotherhood of Cross and Star building, the bin area for Tavern Court appears to have waste dumped from externally. The access gate is normally unlocked to allow bin collection weekly, and it appears someone has gained access illegally. Glass can be seen on the street from where the materials appear to have been dragged in. We do not have evidence of anyone seeing the act, but sounds were heard late on the evening of 9-November

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, New Kent Road, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins and rubbish for weeks, 10th November
item.description:
Outside properties 149/151 Chipperfield Road, there are several overflowing bins and rubbish strewn all over the place. It has been like this for a while and it makes it difficult to walk past with dogs etc who will eat anything. It’s a health hazard
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 153, Chipperfield Road, St Paul's Cray, London
